title: Red-Figure Kylix
subject: maenad; satyr; thyrsus
creator: Attributed to the Oedipus Painter
measurements: 10.5 h x 26 w x 34 d cm
source: Yale University Art Gallery (New Haven, Connecticut, United States of America)
citation: Matheson, Susan B. “Reveling with Dionysos: A Drinking Cup by the Oedipus Painter.” Yale University Art Gallery Bulletin, 2017, 102–9. https://www.jstor.org/stable/26378756.
description: Maenad with thyrsus in both hands assaulting satyr against rocky background.
rights: Public domain. Credit to Yale University Art Gallery. For more information, see https://artgallery.yale.edu/using-images.

title: Red-Figure Lekythos
subject: maenad; mule; grapevine
creator: Attributed to the Leagros Group
source: J. Paul Getty Museum (Malibu, California, United States of America)
citation: Clark, Andrew J. 1990. The J. Paul Getty Museum, Malibu, Fascicule 2. Fasc. 25 of Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum USA. The J. Paul Getty Museum. pls. 68, 70
description: Pictured: Maenad riding a mule. The mule is ithyphallic and branded with a snake on hindquarters. The maenad is wreathed and holds a wrap in her left hand. Not pictured: On the far left, another maenad on a mule (not ithyphallic), and between them, Dionysus.
rights: Public domain. Digital image courtesy of Getty’s Open Content Program. For more information, see https://www.getty.edu/legal/terms-of-use/.

title: Red-Figure Bell-Krater
subject: Dionysos; maenad; satyr; duck
creator: Attributed to the Painter of the Long Overfalls
source: J. Paul Getty Museum (Malibu, California, United States of America)
citation: Jentoft-Nilson, Marit R. and A.D. Trendall. 1990. The J. Paul Getty Museum, Malibu, Fascicule 3. Fasc. 26 of Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum USA. The J. Paul Getty Museum. pl. 143
description: Dionysos sits center holding a narthex in left hand and a kantharos in right. A duck sits below him. A maenad stands to his left holding an oinochoe. A satyr stands to his right holding thyrsus in his left hand and a situla in his right.
rights: Public domain. Digital image courtesy of Getty’s Open Content Program. For more information, see https://www.getty.edu/legal/terms-of-use/.

title: Red-Figure Kylix
subject: maenad; thyrsus; snake
creator: Attributed to the Briseis Painter
source: J. Paul Getty Museum (Malibu, California, United States of America)
citation: True, Marion. 1983. "New Vases by the Brygos Painter and His Circle in Malibu." In Greek Vases In the J. Paul Getty Museum. The J. Paul Getty Museum.
description: Maenad looking back while running. She is holding a thyrsus in her left hand and a snake in her right. She is wearing a patterned sakkoi on her head and a large disc-shaped earring.
rights: Public domain. Digital image courtesy of Getty’s Open Content Program. For more information, see https://www.getty.edu/legal/terms-of-use/.

title: Red-Figure Lekythos
subject: maenad; thyrsus; snake
creator: Attributed to Hermonax
source: Metropolitan Museum of Art (New York City, New York, United States of America)
citation: Gisela M. A. Richter. “The Gallatin Collection of Greek Vases.” The Metropolitan Museum of Art Bulletin 37, no. 3 (1942): 51–59. https://doi.org/10.2307/3256934.; Beazley, John D. 1963. Attic Red-Figure Vase-Painters. 2nd ed. Clarendon Press. p. 490, no. 115
description: Maenad running holding  a snake outstretched in her left hand and a thyrsus in her left.
rights: Public domain. Credit to The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, Rogers Fund. For more information, see https://www.metmuseum.org/policies/frequently-asked-questions-image-and-data-resources.

title: Red-Figure Bell-Krater
subject: maenad; satyr; thyrsus
creator: Attributed to the Meleager Painter
source: Metropolitan Museum of Art (New York City, New York, United States of America)
citation: Beazley, John D. 1963. Attic Red-Figure Vase-Painters. 2nd ed. Clarendon Press. p. 1410, no. 24
description: Two maenads and two satyrs in a line alternating starting with a satyr. The satyrs are standing while the maenads are sitting. The maenads are holding thyrsuses.
rights: Public domain. Credit to The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, Rogers Fund. For more information, see https://www.metmuseum.org/policies/frequently-asked-questions-image-and-data-resources.

title: Red-Figure Column-Krater
subject: maenad; satyr; thyrsus; snake
creator: Attributed to the Pig Painter
source: Metropolitan Museum of Art (New York City, New York, United States of America)
citation: Beazley, John D. 1963. Attic Red-Figure Vase-Painters. 2nd ed. Clarendon Press. p. 564, no. 15
description: Maenad being pursued by satyr. She is holding a thyrsus in her left hand and a snake outstretched toward the satyr in her right. An amphora sits below the satyr.
rights: Public domain. Credit to The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, Rogers Fund. For more information, see https://www.metmuseum.org/policies/frequently-asked-questions-image-and-data-resources.

title: Black-Figure Amphora
subject: Dionysos; Ariadne; maenad; satyr
creator: Namesake of the Class of New York 96.9.9
source: Metropolitan Museum of Art (New York City, New York, United States of America)
citation: Moore, Mary B. and Dietrich von Bothmer. 1976. The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, Fascicule 4. Fasc. 16 of Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum USA. The Metropolitan Museum of Art. Pl. 37, 9-12
description: Dionysos and Ariadne at center. To their left, a maenad playing an aulos and a satyr next to her clapping. To their right, a dancing maenad, a dancing satyr, and a maenad walking right with head bent down.
rights: Public domain. Credit to The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. For more information, see https://www.metmuseum.org/policies/frequently-asked-questions-image-and-data-resources.

title: Red-Figure Pelike
subject: maenad; flute-player; sword; kid
creator: Unknown (Mannerist)
citation: Beazley, John D. “Hydria-Fragments in Corinth.” Hesperia: The Journal of the American School of Classical Studies at Athens 24, no. 4 (1955): 305–19. https://www.jstor.org/stable/147153. Pl. 87; Beazley, John D. 1963. Attic Red-Figure Vase-Painters. 2nd ed. Clarendon Press. p. 586, no. 47
description: Maenad on left holding the hind-leg of a kid high in her left hand and a sword in her right. Flute-player on right.
rights: CC-BY-SA-4.0. Image may be shared and adapted with attribution and the same license. Attributed to Staatliche Museen zu Berlin, Antikensammlung/Johannes Laurentius. For more information, see https://www.smb.museum/en/open-science/use/.

title: Red-Figure Cup
subject: maenad; satyr; thyrsus; grapevine
creator: Attributed to Eretria Painter
citation: Beazley, John D. 1963. Attic Red-Figure Vase-Painters. 2nd ed. Clarendon Press. p. 1253, no. 57
description: Maenad on left holding a thyrsus vertically in her left hand and a grape vine in her right. A satyr stands on her left.
rights: CC-BY-SA-4.0. Image may be shared and adapted with attribution and the same license. Attributed to Staatliche Museen zu Berlin, Antikensammlung/Johannes Laurentius. For more information, see https://www.smb.museum/en/open-science/use/.

title: Black-Figure Oinchoe
subject: maenad; Dionysos; thyrsus; oinochoe
creator: Attributed to Painter of the Half-Palmettes
citation: Beazley, John D. 1956. Attic Black-Figure Vase-Painters. Clarendon Press. p. 429, p. 573, no. 2
description: Maenad on right dancing at the face of Dionysos on left. She is holding a thyrsus in her left hand and an oinochoe in her right.
rights: CC-BY-SA-4.0. Image may be shared and adapted with attribution and the same license. Attributed to Staatliche Museen zu Berlin, Antikensammlung/Johannes Laurentius. For more information, see https://www.smb.museum/en/open-science/use/.

title: Red-Figure Alabastra
subject: maenad; wine; crane; laurel
creator: Attributed to the Group of the Paidikos Alabastra
citation: Murray, A. S. “Two Vases from Cyprus.” The Journal of Hellenic Studies 8 (1887): 317–23. https://www.jstor.org/stable/623480.; Beazley, John D. 1963. Attic Red-Figure Vase-Painters. 2nd ed. Clarendon Press. p. 98, alabastra no. 1
description: Pictured: Maenad facing left holding a branch of laurel in each hand. She is accepting a cup of wine. Not picture: A crane painted in black to the left of the pictured maenad, and a second maenad facing right holding a cup of wine in her outstretched left hand.

title: Red-Figure Amphora
subject: Dionysos; maenad; satyr; grapevine; snake; thyrsus
creator: Recalls the Euergides Painter
citation: Walters, H.B. 1927. British Museum, Fascicule 3. Fasc. 4 of Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain. The Trustees of the British Museum. III Ic Pl. 2, 1; Beazley, John D. 1963. Attic Red-Figure Vase-Painters. 2nd ed. Clarendon Press. p. 35, no. 2
description: Dionysos standing center holding a kantharos and a grapevine. Maenad on right holding a thyrsus in her left hand and a snake in her right. Satyr on left plucking grapes from Dionysos' vine.

title: Black-Figure Kylix
subject: gorgoneion; maenad; satyr; mule
creator: Unknown
citation: Walters, H.B. 1893. Black-Figured Vases. Vol. 2 of Catalogue of the Greek and Etruscan Vases in the British Museum. The Trustees of the British Museum. B427; Smith, A.H. and F.N. Pryce. 1926. British Museum, Fascicule 2. Fasc. 2 of Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britian. The Trustees of the British Musuem. III H e Pl. 20, 2
description: In the center, a gorgoneion with tongue extend and tusks. Around it, a Dionysiac thiasos feature maenads, satyrs, and a ithyphallic mule. Note: CVA features images prior to the piece's breaking. The description in the British Museum catalogue matches those images.
rights: © The Trustees of the British Museum. Shared under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0) licence. title: Red-Figure Amphora
subject: maenad; satyr; thyrsus; panther
creator: Attributed to the Briseis Painter
citation: Smith, Cecil H. 1896. Vases of the Finest Period. Vol. 3 of Catalogue of the Greek and Etruscan Vases in the British Museum. The Trustees of the British Museum. E319; Beazley, John D. 1963. Attic Red-Figure Vase-Painters. 2nd ed. Clarendon Press. p. 409, no. 50
description: Maenad being pursued by satyr. She is holding a thyrsus in her left hand and wearing a panther skin.
